did.unittitle: Frick Fine Arts Library Artist Files

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of Pittsburgh. Department of Fine Arts

did.abstract: The Frick Fine Arts Library Artist Files contains numerous biographies, exhibition catalogs, announcements and more, that was collected by the library staff. Materials are primarily from the 1950s-1980s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Frick Fine Arts Library Artist Files contains numerous biographies, exhibition catalogs, and announcements, such as posters, postcards, and letters mailed to the library. Additional ephemera includes newspaper clippings and magazine articles. Notable items are indicated at the folder level.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Frick Fine Arts Library Subject Files, 1939-1989, FFAL.001, Frick Fine Arts Library, University of Pittsburgh

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Elizabeth England in July 2016.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Frick Fine Arts Library Artist Files, 1892-1990, FFAL.002, Frick Fine Arts Library, University of Pittsburgh

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in its original order as maintained by the Frick Fine Arts Library. Some shifting of materials was done in order to place artists according to the Library of Congress Name Authority File. Series 1 contains folders of artists grouped alphabetically by last name. Series 2 consists of folders devoted to individual artists.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Frick Fine Arts Library collected materials relating to individual artists in the Pittsburgh region, nationally, and some internationally. The majority of the materials were amassed after the library moved from the Cathedral of Learning to the new Frick Fine Arts Building in 1965.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Artist files arranged in alphabetical groupings.
